title: "Hard engage supports counter Sona"
body:
Can you not?

http://i.imgur.com/x04DYkM.jpg

Sona literally doesnt have a single losing match up. The hard engage supports that "counter Sona" actually have some of the worst winrates against her. So can people stop bombarding threads with this misinformation? You're making it harder and harder to take the pro-Sona side seriously. 

Thanks.

I dislike how strong Sona is but lets not get over reactive here, Thresh, without a doubt, has the ability to make a hard engage happen with his hook/pull-flay-ult, but any solid Thresh players extremely rarely will do this unless they know for certain they will make the kill happen or if there is  very unique circumstance for doing so. Most of the time its hook, walk forward, flay into ult so the hooked champion is right in the vicinity of The Box's range so they get the slow immediately. This is the more ideal move probably 90% of the time and it hardly counts as a hard engage as Thresh rarely will launch himself towards his hooked target, even though he has the option to do so. The ones that do use the pull portion of the hook constantly, are typically the ones that are new to his kit.

Pretty sure the problem with Sona right now has almost nothing to do with her laning phase, and everything to do with her late game, cooldowns and sheer healing numbers.

And a lot of the supports you circled suffer in the late game because the gold deficit they have as a support doesn't allow them to build as much tank as they need to contend with enemy laners, and not because they're losing lane to Sona...

what people need to stop saying is "hard engage supports counter Sona"

what they need to start saying is "hard engage counters Sona"

If you take Leona, Sona is perfectly capable of sitting back in lane and keeping her laner alive. However if you take Leona and after level 6 are constantly forcing all-ins on ultimate CD, you'll at least make Sona's life difficult. I think the problem is people pick stuff like Leona or Thresh into Sona thinking it's gonna be ezpz but really, you still have to play the lane way more aggressively than you might normally play it to really get an advantage over Sona.

This way you can at least force her to max W, which basically stabilizes your lane into a farm lane - or kill her/her ADC a couple times, making it much easier to handle her. Once Sona gets behind she stays behind and she can really feel it, especially now that hitting level 6 is more than just unlocking Crescendo.

>This way you can at least force her to max W

If Sona is doing that against Leona, she's making a huge mistake. W doesn't give enough shielding and regen to do anything, and it guarantees that you can't do enough damage to Leona's ADC to dissuade them from going in again. It also takes away from your ability to poke the Leona and her ADC out level 3-5, which is a huge part of the matchup.

I don't care how aggressive the Leona is, I'm maxing Q. There is no situation where I wouldn't. Even we're losing hard, I wouldn't max W, because that just guarantees that we'll never be able to get a cross kill in a gank, and it means that I won't be able to do enough damage to roam effectively at 6 (and roaming at 6 or even before 6 is exactly what I'll do in a losing lane).

>I think the problem is people pick stuff like Leona or Thresh into Sona thinking it's gonna be ezpz but really, you still have to play the lane way more aggressively than you might normally play it to really get an advantage over Sona.

I kind of disagree. I actually think the problem is exactly the opposite: People pick Leona into Sona thinking they can win every trade, and as a result they go in literally all the time, and they play up on you thinking that the threat of an engage will make you back off. The thing is, Sona's heal and poke design is based around taking trades that are even slightly bad, and punishing them horribly, and she can actually resist getting bursted down thanks to her shield/heal. Pre-6, if Leona and her ADC don't get all of their burst off very quickly, Sona can turn it into a sustained trade that she and her ADC will almost always win. After 6, Leona's ults have to be followed up very quickly, and she has to go in while Sona isn't in a position to stun her ADC, or else Leona will lose most of her stun uptime and sunlight procs while her ADC is getting bursted. The impetus is on Leona to take only the best fights, and way too many people will just go 100% ham 100% of the time.

Ever since Sona got the shield added and had her base stats increased, I actually think that Leona really doesn't do great against Sona. If the matchup is played absolutely perfectly, Leona will win, but even small mistakes open her up for a ton of punishment. I will specifically pick Sona into Leona because of this.

If you've died more than twice against Leona you should at least be putting a couple extra points in W (imo) just because it's unlikely at that point that the slight additional damage from Q will really matter. With Q getting nerfed and W getting buffed, I think people are kind of clinging to the Q max - most of the damage comes from powerchord (which was buffed and isn't based on Q level at all), so there's no reason to continue to max Q if you lose kill pressure, especially against a lane like Leona where if you have no kill pressure you're basically free.

And while you are right about Leona needing to take the right fights, if Leona takes the right fight twice in a row Sona and her ADC basically automatically lose the lane. I understand that Sona is definitely stronger now than she was before, but she still gets dunked by Leona played well - you just actually have to know how to play Leona, which I feel is a staggeringly low percentage of the League of Legends population these days.

So the only counter to Sona is to ask a 3v2 to you jungler? Against a support?

okay 1 I have never once said that current Sona is balanced (lol). But what beats her is not just "oh I have a Thresh in my lane" - you beat her by consistently hard engaging on her. It's a poke comp - it's exactly how you dealt with Nidalee back in the day, too - if you let Sona sit behind her ADC and continue to heal and poke she will win the lane, but if you hard engage on her before her heal can reset the lane that's how you beat her. The problem is people pick melee hard engage supports into Leona expecting to have an EZPZ lane but it's still a skill matchup.

AGAIN, I don't think Sona is balanced, right now. She needs nerfs. But people talking about her like she's a free win need to remember that Sona's pretty susceptible to getting caught out and to teams with heavy hard engage. She's still weak to these things, even while overtuned.

read my posts please. you're not even replying to me. 

I never once said she was balanced.

I said that Sona does poorly against hard engage (which was true). You can sit here and say I'm wrong (lol) all you want, but it's a squishy champion who has to be inside her team to tag with auras and has to get inside AA range to "burst" her target. 

Also, the change DID nerf her laning phase (pre-6), but the level 1 Crescendo is too powerful for her CDs. Her Hymn of Valor (Q) and Power Chord damage is LOWER by about 40 damage in the early game, so her burst was nerfed.

Again, I DON'T THINK SONA IS BALANCED. Just for those in the back **I DON'T THINK SONA IS BALANCED**.

People need to actually look at what's wrong with her though before we have to watch Sona once again get nerfed multiple times in a row while ignoring that the reason she's oppressive is not because she does damage or has a heal+shield it's because she has all of these things on top of an instant cast AoE stun.

Sona doesn't need numbers nerfs - she needs an entirely new ultimate that actually makes sense on an enchanting support. It would literally instantly fix every single problem with Sona, because she's way less oppressive when you can actually engage on her without her just instantly stunning you and your ADC and walking away/killing both of you. It makes sense for someone like Janna to have a disengage ultimate - she can't really utilize the CC for herself aside from peeling for an ADC, because she doesn't have any sort of significant damage, and I feel she pays for it by having a bit less team utility than Sona.  The only reason we still have Crescendo is because Riot is afraid of alienating the Sona playerbase, but if you look back over Sona's patch history Crescendo is consistently listed as one of the reasons she's strong, even though it literally hasn't had a significant change since a range nerf in season 1.

You can say that hard engage champs counters sona as much as you want, but facts are facts, and its a fact that i didnt even won a single 2v2 with leona against her.

Her ult is the reason her kit is oppressive. I've played over 2k games of Sona. trust me bro.

I have way more experience with the champ than you will literally ever have. I've played her since Season 1. And I can tell you, if you're losing to Sona pre-level 6 you would've lost to Sona last patch too. 

Her numbers were **NERFED** on her damage this patch. **NERFED**. And her heal received a net nerf on low health targets (AND IT'S GETTING NERFED NEXT PATCH). All I'm saying is Riot has done this song and dance over, and over, and over. AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER. We've seen numbers nerf after numbers nerf after NUMBERS NERF after numbers nerf on Sona and it's literally never fixed her problems.

Yes, remove her oppressiveness and the braindeadness. Neither of those things will be fixed by flat damage nerfs, I'm telling you now. Because she's not oppressive because of the numbers on any of her abilities, and advocating further nerfs knowing that is ridiculous. I mean hell, her Q at level 5 does 220 damage if you hit with your AA as well - for reference, {{champion:267}} W at level 5 does 230 damage as well, potentially to two enemy targets (just like Sona's Q) AND it heals an allied champ at the same time for 185 health, AND it speeds up the allied target. Nami's W ratio is only .2 lower than the combined ratio on Sona's Q and autoattack. For reference a level 9 Sona has a 40HP heal and shield available to her. LOL.

Sona is a lategame support who right now carries too much early game threat because she has access to a very powerful disengage/engagement ult. Riot needs to find a way to line up that fantasy with Sona, and I really don't think reducing her damage numbers is really the issue.

Additionally, removing Sona's ultimate has a pretty huge effect on her in general - when Sona has no instant AoE stun, she can no longer really safely rush full AP. It becomes a lot more dangerous for Sona to go AP because she no longer has an oh shit button that can facilitate her either oneshotting someone or disengaging from a situation she should be dead in. This would fix a lot of Sona's numbers problems in the mid and lategame fairly easy by pushing her into more utility focused purchases like {{item:3190}} - when the champion becomes riskier to play, building AP becomes less useful (especially when, really, you're a support who shouldn't be prioritizing your own personal damage anyway, but rather your ability to keep your team alive).

Please no. Do people not realize that the reason this shit keeps happening is because they need to STOP just mindlessly buffing and nerfing Sona and actually look at why her kit is so oppressive. Like, seriously, between Sona's release and her rework, she was nerfed 8 times with nothing more than mana cost adjustments given as compensation. Then she was updated (which you can consider a nerf or a buff, depending), received 2 more nerfs, and now we're here.

This champion (clearly) can't be controlled with purely numbers changes, as Riot has been attempting to find a balanced spot for her since Season 1 and basically what happens is: Riot nerfs Sona multiple times when she gets strong, Sona fades. Items change, Sona comes back, Riot nerfs her again. Rinse and repeat.

This time we just got the item change in combination with a Sona buff so everyone is losing their minds while forgetting that we've had heal values all over the map - including a point where Sona's level 1 heal only healed 25 HP, because they wanted to force Sona who wanted to be a good healer into maxing W - and she still managed to come back into the game. It's unlikely that the PBE heal value nerfs will do jack and shit for Sona's actual problems, and yet people will just be like NERF HERRRRR without realizing that that's how you end up with champs like pre-rework Eve and Yorick.

Auto-target Q and instant-cast AoE stun will make everything else on her kit oppressive, regardless of the numbers. I wish Riot would realize that so they could actually address the problem instead of just nerfing Sona over and over.

Nice text, but she still needs a "HERRR DERR NERRF"

You literally didn't read my post though. The reason she's oppressive isn't because she does damage (lots of supports do that, and better - {{champion:143}} comes to mind) or even that she also heals AND does damage AND speeds up ({{champion:267}} ) - it's that she does all of these things while also having an **instant cast AoE stun**. At least Zyra's knockup is delayed and close range. At least Nami's wave is really slow and easy to dodge.

Sona QWE by themselves are far from oppressive - if you think that's oppressive it must bother you to know that Soraka Q does more damage at all ranks and her heal is also better and lower CD (AND she has access to CC outside of her ultimate). The only problem with her base spells is the auto-target Q - the numbers on them are pathetic in comparison to every single other support in the game. This is literally the problem - people like you who say "OH SHE'S BRAINDEAD NERF HER". No, you don't NERF braindead champs, you make them not braindead. Flat numbers nerfs will NEVER, EVER fix Sona's problems, because she ALREADY has some of the lowest numbers on her base abilities and the damage on Crescendo is not the problem in her kit. It's like how GP was fluctuating wildly between being a powerfarming monsterbeast or worthless for a couple of season - they added complexity to his kit so they could have additional levers to balance that weren't just "damage". Sona really only has base numbers and CDs to change, and I feel like they've had everything from release Sona's incredibly, super short CDs starting at level 1 to initially post-rework the incredibly long CDs and it's never really fixed her problems.

What frustrates me is that (for example), the values on the PBE nerf aren't even new heal values for Sona - it's just a revert to a previous patch. Like, if none of the numbers you've tried have worked and you've been trying for like 3 or 4 years now, maybe the numbers aren't the problem. Maybe flat nerfs won't fix this champion.
